docs.lead_paragraph: New guidelines widely expand the category of who should take statins.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author John D Abramson and cardiologist Rita F Redberg criticizes recommendation by American Heart Assn and American College of Cardiology that millions of Americans should immediately start taking statins; holds recommendation is consequence of simply expanding the definition of who should take drugs and who will benefit the pharmaceutical industry more than anyone else.
docs.snippet: New guidelines widely expand the category of who should take statins.

byline.original: By JOHN D. ABRAMSON and RITA F. REDBERG

headline.main: Schools That Separate the Child From the Trauma

docs.abstract: Punishing children for misbehavior they don’t know how to control only adds to their suffering.
docs.snippet: Punishing children for misbehavior they don’t know how to control only adds to their suffering.

docs.lead_paragraph: The guidelines from the nation’s leading heart organizations will fundamentally reshape the use of cholesterol-lowering statin medicines now prescribed for a quarter of Americans over 40.

headline.main: Experts Reshape Treatment Guide for Cholesterol
headline.print_headline: Experts Reshape Treatment Guide For Cholesterol

docs.abstract: Nation’s leading heart organizations release new guidelines fundamentally reshaping use of cholesterol-lowering statin medicines; patients on statins will no longer need to lower cholesterol levels to specific numerical targets, but will simply take right dose; previously, emphasis on lowering cholesterol levels by specific amounts meant patients not hitting target levels with statins alone were often prescribed additional drugs.
docs.snippet: The guidelines from the nation’s leading heart organizations will fundamentally reshape the use of cholesterol-lowering statin medicines now prescribed for a quarter of Americans over 40.

headline.main: Warnings on Children’s Drugs Found to Help Curb Misuse
headline.print_headline: Warnings on Children’s Drugs Found to Help Curb Misuse

docs.abstract: Safety measures by the makers of children’s cough and cold medicines have decreased emergency visits by toddlers with suspected medical problems after using these drugs, government researchers found.
docs.snippet: Safety measures by the makers of children’s cough and cold medicines have decreased emergency visits by toddlers with suspected medical problems after using these drugs, government researchers found.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
